title: Election Commission of India ad is a waste of tax-payer's money.
selftext: Full page ad in Times of India, Mumbai, Monday, 3 June, 2024
comments: Atleast these are good rather then those ads by government where they try to gain popularity by giving out false info on the schemes they introduced ðŸ˜”ðŸ˜…

How is this a waste? This will encourage youth to become first time voters. This is putting casting your vote as a positive action. It's a good use of our money. We need more people to come out and vote.

1.35 lakh crore spent for 2024 elections! 

Just to put that in perspective...that money is equal to...

2024-2025 budget allocation for the following ministers combined.

ISRO - 13,042 Cr.
Ministry of Atomic energy - 24,968 Cr
Health ministry - 90,658 Cr
Fisheries - 2,352 Cr
Environment ministry - 3,265 Cr


And still short of 1000 Cr ....

So much of our money spent on elections. Hope we choose a worthy government.
Let's also divide the election budget by 5, as this expenditure is incurred every 5 years. Let's also put our support for one nation one election when it lands.
One nation one election leads to to further centralization of power and lower accountability towards citizens. It is ripe for abuse no matter who sits in the chair.
Lol if it hasn't gone through your head yet, it is election outreach. And conducting an election on this scale isn't easy, especially in a country like ours.
What is the cost of this ad?

Thanks for your comment.

Now I understand that "outreach" is the latest fancy word for wasting the tax-payer's money.

So, because it is not easy to conduct an election on this scale, we have a good excuse for wasting money.

You're talking like as if they misspent and laundered money that was meant for a highway project.

Yes, it's not easy to conduct an election on a scale like India. People came to vote him sweltering heat and I think it's not unreasonable to thank them.
Mind taking over and showing them how its done? ðŸ¤”
